headline: Quick Beef Stir-Fry
description: This beef stir-fry is quick and easy for busy weeknights. Thin slices of beef sirloin are stir-fried with colorful vegetables and soy sauce.

video.description: Need to use up some of your leftover vegetables and pantry staple ingredients? Look no further than this quick beef stir-fry recipe. This video shows you how to make beef stir-fry with vegetables like broccoli, bell pepper, carrots, and green onion.
video.name: Quick Beef Stir-Fry Recipe

name: Quick Beef Stir-Fry
recipeIngredient: 1 pound beef sirloin, cut into 2-inch strips
1 red bell pepper, cut into matchsticks

recipeInstructions.text: Heat vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat; cook and stir beef until browned, 3 to 4 minutes.
Move beef to the side of the wok and add broccoli, bell pepper, carrots, green onion, and garlic to the center of the wok. Cook and stir vegetables for 2 minutes.
Stir beef into vegetables and season with soy sauce and sesame seeds. Continue to cook and stir until vegetables are tender, about 2 more minutes.

review.reviewBody: Easy and tasty
I used a Beef Chuck Roast cut into 2 inch strips. It was really good. Saved myself a little money Too!

Missing all the flavor. Recommend adding a sweetener (mirin, brown sugar, maple syrup), some ginger, and maybe Sriracha. Definitely season the meat with salt and pepper at a bare minimum. Seasame oil has better flavor than vegetable.

Used leftover Korean BBQ brisket from Costco, added two table spoons of fresh ginger, used 8 oz of sliced mushrooms cooked ahead of time with salt and pepper. Also a bulb of garlic (you can never have too much garlic). Came out great will definitely put this in my arsenal to use leftover meats.
So delicious!
It was really easy and very good! Thanks for sharing this recipe.
It was very easy and yummy!

We made this recipe today, it was delicious and very easy to make. I had to to use another cut of meat as there wasn't sirloin beef in the supermarket. We really enjoyed it, I recommend to try this recipe if you're looking for something quick and easy to make!
This is so quick and delicious! My husband said "keep this recipe!"

Extremely bland. I added chili paste and some hoison sauce to perk it up but was still just mediocre. I did love the look of the dish with all of the colors and may continue to modify until right. Will start with using a cut other than sirloin
I think it needed more flavor. I can’t pinpoint what but my son added black pepper and some sea salt to his plate.
So easy and delicious. Thank you i really enjoyed it
Easy and tasty. Added tablespoon minced ginger, tabasco peppers, more carrots, turmeric and other spices. Cooked in peanut oil.
I liked the simplicity of this recipe. I would marinade the beef overnight. It was tough. But love the Vegas. I served mine with rice. Yummy.
It was a good recipe! I just used broccoli and shredded carrots. Also I used a tad bit more soy sauce and add ginger.

It was easy to make and delicious. My family really enjoyed it. I thinnly sliced and fried beef round steak with onions and green pepper. Then I used Sam's Club Stir Fry Vegetables, added more garlic and more broccoli. Cooked that for a couple minutes and add a little Soy Sauce. I did not add the sesame seeds. It is so good!

I'd highly recommend looking up how to "Velvet" the beef before stir frying it if you aren't in a rush. Velveting only takes baking soda and time and it makes it 1000% more tender. It's the secret to how chinese restaurant beef melts in your mouth and stuff from home doesn't.
Delicious and easy to make! Definitely going to reuse and share this recipe!

I love this recipe. I did change it a bit the 2nd time. I used pea pods in place of carrots. A little teriyaki, and some ginger. Just little changes because the recipe is great! I make it every other week now.

I did what the other reviewer said except I didn’t use the ginger added little salt and pepper to the meat at the beginning and that’s when I put in my garlic as well then continued with the rest except I didn’t use green onion I diced up small yellow onion and added and it was super delicious 🤗🤗🤗 my 1 year old baby boy loved it too 😍
Turn out good. I think
I marinated the meat for a couple if hrs. I added bean sprouts and water chestnuts, served on a bed of rice. It was delicious, I'd make it again
Added Thai chili's for a kick, and some oyster mushrooms. Good flavors, but the sirloin cut is too tough of a meat.
Quick, easy, delicious. Added a few green beans and some broccoli.
I seasoned the beef with a little garlic powder and season salt and that made it extra tasty. I also added a little terriaki sauce once everything was done cooking. Definitely will be cooking again

Very good dish. I added about 2 tablespoons fresh ginger (cut up) and a little rice wine vinegar. I would have preferred more brocolli and less red bell pepper, just for our tastes. As other reviewers said, it could use a little more soy sauce or other seasoning and more "sauce" in the pan to drizzle over rice.
Added about 1/2 tbsp Himalayan salt, 1 tsp pepper and garlic and onion powder (didn’t measure)
Very bland. I added ginger, but still bland. I’ve used Allrecipes for several years and this is my first review-this recipe needs a lot more flavor.
i like how easy it is to make.
Super easy
The only thing I changed was to use olive oil instead of vegetable oil. This dish was great! I will be making it again.
Meat needs to be marinated first and possibly cooked separately to avoid being dried out.
We did not use sesame seeds because we can never find them here!
This recipe is wonderful ?? thank you
This is a great recipe as it is or perfect to customize. Healthy and tasty!

It was ok. I used london broil and tried to add other veggies from another recipe. Unfortunately, it still needed flavor. Maybe teriyaki sauce? That was my son's suggestion. Definitely a great starter.
Fantastic. I added some water chestnuts and mushrooms and a little soy afterwards. Delicious.
No carrots or sesame seeds but did follow recipe to exact directions added with rice. Huge hit for tonight's dinner.

Delicious! Didn’t have scallions (green onions), so I used a sweet onion in its place. I also added a small amount of sesame oil and fresh mushrooms. This is a very versatile recipe, and I will be making some version of it repeatedly.
Good recipe. I changed a few ingredients (soy and sesame) and added a brown gravy. Served over rice is amazing
So so delicious. And I'm not a beef person, but wow. Would highly recommend this. Had mine with a side of basmati rice.

Delicious! The only thing I did differently was move the steak to another dish while I cooked the veggies because my pan wasn't large enough. Other than that, I stuck to the recipe. It was simple, yet delicious. Definitely a keeper! Thanks!

Our family of 5 loved this! It was just the right amount for us! I doubled the garlic (we love garlic) and added fresh shredded ginger (we love ginger). Otherwise, I made it as is!, and it was wonderful! I made Rice a Roni Beef rice with it, and everyone took the amount of rice/stir fry they wanted. I put the soy sauce bottle on the table, and a few added extra soy sauce just because they love it. Mmmmm! Be sure to prep the veggies first, start the rice (if you serve this with rice), and then start the recipe. The wok heats up fast, and veggies need to be ready, or you'll overcook the meat. Also, our grocery store's meat department cut the steak into 2 inch pieces for me (though they were more like 4 inches, so I snipped them in half with a scissors - still it helped with prep). Thanks for an awesome recipe! We will be having this again for sure!!!
Easy to make and absolutely delicious!
Delish! The only thing I changed was that I didn't have fresh garlic or sesame seeds. I used garlic powder. About to make it again, second time within a week.

Made it with some of the changes recommended by others. Added some garlic and Herb seasoning to the beef in the fridge for a few hours before cooking. Added some rice wine and extra veggies. Will definitely make again.

Great recipe to start with! My boyfriend and I really enjoyed this and will be making it again for sure! I preseasoned my steak with S & P and let it rest at room temp before cooking. I used 1 Tb of sesame oil and 1 Tb olive oil instead of vegetable oil. Browned the whole steak 3-4 min on each side till it was cooked medium. I took it off the heat and put in minced ginger, minced garlic, chopped peppers, onions and broccoli florets into the pan. I also added a tsp of hoisin sauce to the soy sauce and sautéed the veggies until slightly softened. Then I sliced the steak and added it to the veggies to reheat it for about 3 minutes. Served over rice. Delish!

i made it an my family loved it! the youngest ate every veggie 1st!! hah i did follow the recipe for the most part. but i doubled up the veggies an added yellow onions, celery an whatever veggie i had. i doubled everything as i was feeding a family of 6! 
also for flavour a added garlic, an onion salt, ginger an soya sauce with water in a small container an mixed it then topped everything with it as i was cooking to add flavor, as i make stir fry alot an tried this out but added my own touch. was great tho!
I added snap peas to my veggie input
It actually tasted pretty good. I added in more spices to make it taste better, though.
Family all liked it.
we both loved this recipe it was quick and easy it did however need a little more flavor I added some ginger it could have used more garlic next time!
Turned out great
Not yet & will definitely make it again

Pretty good base. Saw some reviews stating it was a little bland, so added oyster sauce, soy sauce, sambal sauce and ginger. Very savory! Didn't have broccoli but it was good with just red bell pepper and carrots. Perfect over a cup (or two--it's that savory) of rice. Will make again for sure!
A quick, easy and versatile recipe.
I added some honey teriyaki sauce and served with noodles.. it was very good but beef was a little tough. I would make again but would cut the beef a bit thinner.
GREAT recipe try it with a bit of sweet sour sauce!!
Great dish and super easy to make. I added Teriyaki and some chili flakes for more flavour. My teens love it too??

I just made this. It turned out great! I made this for 6 people, but there were only 4 of us. We ate it all, lol.

I had peppers, napa cabbage, carrots and onions; they worked well. I used sliced ribeye. 

I added some red pepper flakes to it, for a little spicy bite. 

I'm going to try it again with chicken and asparagus. 

The homemade teriyaki sauce is very good. I boosted the ginger because I'm fond of that flavor. About twice as much as the recipe called for.
I am on WW and make this a lot. It is quick and freezes well. Sometimes I add bok choy also.

This recipe is great! Super simple and easy. I added garlic and used stir fry sauce in addition to the soy sauce and it was awesome! Also used sesame oil in place of vegetable oil for a more authentic taste, but would be good either way!
Turned out amazing. I added snow peas. This will be in constant rotation for quick dinners.
I've mad this twice. Once with beef and one with chicken. I enjoyed both. Quick and easy! Does not have super robust flavor.
easy for real
it was amazing, really savory
The meat was a little chewy, but that may have been my fault. Taste was great.

A good, easy recipe. I followed the instructions to the letter as I often do when trying a new dish.
My wife and I both loved it!
Will definitely make it again but will probably add some mushrooms and cherry tomatoes. Also will use Tamari Sauce instead of Soy Sauce.
My only complaint would be that it would in no way feed six people (I think that is what it said).
And to those who say it is bland, maybe so but put a jar of Chilli Paste or Spicy Mustard on the table and let everyone season it as they please. I just used a little more Soy Sauce and it was great!
easy, but not much flavour

I agree - it needs a little "something". I also used ginger. Used thinly sliced green peppers; Vidalia onions; and shaved carrots for vegetables. Sesame seeds are a great texture enhancement. Served with packaged Spanish rice, with same pepper/onion/carrot mixed in. Turned out fine!
This is great! I substituted sesame oil for vegetable oil though, and next time will add mushrooms & water chestnuts.
Took out sesame seeds
good recipe easy to change it up . mustard seeds and Anaheim and poblano. heaps of meals??

Quick and easy recipe! I added yellow onion in place of green onions and I thought it was a nice addition. I also added a little crushed red pepper flakes. It certainly wasn't bland, but it wouldn't hurt to add a little flavor.
It's good but it needs salt.

Yummy! I seasoned the meat with some McCormicks steak seasoning, seared it in garlic-infused olive oil, and while it finished cooking I tossed in some chopped onion until soft. I dumped that into a bowl and put broccoli, red bell pepper and zucchini in the pan with a little more garlic olive oil and a splash of coconut aminos (soy allergy). When the veggies were done, I put the meat back in the pan, added another splash of coconut aminos, stirred it up and served it over rice. SO good! Can’t wait to try it with other veggies!
I used tenderloin which was delicious . It comes out less saucy than what you get at a restaurant. I added rice wine at the end with the soy sauce. It still tasted good.
Outstanding! I only added 2 tbsp of fresh cut ginger. Delicious!
I added a little fish sauce, ginger and some red pepper flakes just because we like heat. Easy and Delicious Recipe Thank you

I did like this, and so did my husband, but there was not as much flavor as we like. I think the next time I make it I will add some ginger. Will comment again after I try it.
It was very simple to make, which I greatly appreciated!
I love to cook this now for my kids
my fiance loved it
I think my partner will enjoy this
Delicious, quick and easy! Able to substitute chicken or other vegetables easily. One of our favorites!
Will definitely make again
Awesome dinner and I feel like I ate healthy!
Fast and easy and great tasting. I decided to eye ball the soy and opted to allow guest to add more if they wanted. Omitted the sesame seeds since I did not have them.
This was a bit bland so I added Hoisin sauce for more flavor.
quick, easy, and yummy!
Added mushrooms but it still would have been awesome!!

Quick and easy to make on any night. I made some tweaks for my alterations: I swapped the beef for chicken, use regular sesame seeds untoasted, use 4 sliced baby carrots instead of one carrot, and use brown rice instead of cauliflower rice. Since I didn't have any green onions, I passed on it. I would make it again and add some water chestnuts to it.
Easy to make and tastes great.
Absolutely loved it - substituted Pork for Beef and it still turned out amazing!
Quick, easy, tasty. Can't ask for more.
Only a 4 cause I can't cook to specifications
Add more broccoli and water chestnuts
Smells really GOOD
Added red raspberry to give more flavor!
My family absolutely loved this recipe.
